sect1.title: Pod Deployment with Podman
sect1.para: In addition to building and managing images, &podman; makes it possible to work with pods. A pod is a group of one or more containers, with shared storage and network resources. A pod usually encapsulates an application composed of multiple containers into a single unit.

The podman pod can be used to create, delete, query, and inspect pods. To create a new pod, run the podman pod create --name PODNAME command. This creates a pod with a random name. To list the existing pods, use the podman pod list command. To view a list of running pods, run podman ps -a --pod. Notice that the created pod has an infra container identified by the k8s.gcr.io name. The purpose of this container is to keep the namespaces associated with the pod and allow &podman; to add other containers to the pod.
